channel.title: Javac problem still with Compiler. Help Please and Thank You
channel.description:
Well, I am starting to make a server. When i start the compiler, an error pops out in the command window saying javac is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program, or batch file, Press any key to continue... I have set my environmental variables. Here they are. I got JDK 6u5
CLASSPATH Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
PATH C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin
The help would be perfect!

item.title: Javac problem still with Compiler. Help Please and Thank You
item.dc:creator: @dragon_boy dragon boy
item.description:
@dragon_boy wrote:

I downloaded the latest java and restarted the computer. Still says

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin\javac.exe is not recognized as an internal or external command[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 23, 2008, 08:48:24 AM[/size][hr][quote=“CupofTea, post:3, topic:192133”]Go into you’re Program Files,
There should be ‘Java’
And there should be something like this:
jdk1.6.0_01
if it doesnt look exactly like that,
change the folder name to it.
it should be working fine then.[/quote]
When I go to start then all programs I don’t see a java tab. There is a java icon in control panel though.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 23, 2008, 08:53:07 AM[/size][hr]Wait I found the folder. It has these folders in them
jdk1.6.0_05
jre1.5.0_11
jre1.5.0_09
jre1.6.0_01
jre1.6.0_03
jre1.6.0_02
jre1.6.0_05

Read full topic
item.source: Javac problem still with Compiler. Help Please and Thank You

item.title: Javac problem still with Compiler. Help Please and Thank You
item.dc:creator: @CupofTea CupofTea
item.description:
@CupofTea wrote:

Go into you’re Program Files,
There should be ‘Java’
And there should be something like this:
jdk1.6.0_01
if it doesnt look exactly like that,
change the folder name to it.
it should be working fine then.
